Instance.description: An interaction that has a series of waypoints the the actor routes to for the run of the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: max_goal_clipping_score_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this override for the max goal clipping score on the routing context is used when generating goals.

Tunable.name: waypoint_clear_locomotion_mask
Tunable.description: If enabled, override the locomotion queue mask. This mask controls which Animation Requests and XEvents get blocked during locomotion. By default, the mask blocks everything. If cleared, it blocks nothing. It also lowers the animation track used by locomotion to 9,999 from the default of 10,000. Use with care, ask your GPE.

TunableVariant.name: waypoint_constraint
TunableVariant.description: Define how the waypoints are generated.

TunableTuple.name: connected_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on a predefined graph defined using locators. Will attempt to avoid backtracking. Can specify either an ending waypoint, a maximum number of waypoints to traverse, or both.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: ending_waypoint
TunableTuple.description: Waypoint for the generator to end at (will choose one based on the tests/weights).

TunableList.name: connections
TunableList.description: List of connected waypoints.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of waypoint and a tested weight.

Tunable.name: connected_waypoint
Tunable.description: Waypoint reference.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A weight with testable multipliers that is used to determine how likely this entry is to be picked when selecting randomly.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: max_waypoints
Tunable.description: The maximum number of waypoints to visit. Set to 0 to keep going until ending_waypoint is reached.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: starting_waypoint
TunableTuple.description: Waypoint for the generator to start at (will choose one based on the tests/weights).

TunableList.name: connections
TunableList.description: List of connected waypoints.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of waypoint and a tested weight.

Tunable.name: connected_waypoint
Tunable.description: Waypoint reference.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A weight with testable multipliers that is used to determine how likely this entry is to be picked when selecting randomly.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableVariant.name: waypoint_graph
TunableVariant.description: Defines the waypoints and connections between them. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a WaypointGraph tuning snippet.)

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for defining a graph of connected waypoints (locators).

TunableList.name: connections
TunableList.description: Defines the connections between waypoints in this graph.

TunableTuple.name: connections
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for a weighted list of connections (linked waypoint locators).

TunableList.name: connections
TunableList.description: List of connected waypoints.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of waypoint and a tested weight.

Tunable.name: connected_waypoint
Tunable.description: Waypoint reference.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A weight with testable multipliers that is used to determine how likely this entry is to be picked when selecting randomly.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: waypoint
Tunable.description: Waypoint reference.

Tunable.name: constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each of the generated waypoint constraints.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a WaypointGraph tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: ellipse
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated on an ellipse.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: offset
TunableTuple.description: The offset of the ellipse relative to the target's position.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

Tunable.name: orientation
Tunable.description: The orientation of the ellipse relative to the target's orientation. The major axis is X if the angle is 0. If the angle is 90 degrees, then the major axis is Z.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: x_radius_interval
TunableTuple.description: The min and max radius of the x axis. Make the interval 0 to get rid of variance.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: z_radius_interval
TunableTuple.description: The min and max radius of the z axis. Make the interval 0 to get rid of variance.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: footprint
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated on the bounds of the target's footprint.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: corner_radius
Tunable.description: The min and max radius of the corner. This determines how tight the corners are.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: offset_size
Tunable.description: The offset of the footprint. positive means we enlarge the footprint, negative means we shrink it.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: gig_objects
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on the possible objects added during the gig. As of 2/23/21, this is only supported by the GP10 Interior Decorator Gig, pulling objects stored by the client-side Gig Object Tracker.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constrain_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the circle that will be generated around the objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_max_distance
Tunable.description: The maximum distance to check for an object as the next target of our waypoint interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_search_strategy
TunableVariant.description: Search strategies to find and soft the possible objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: default_waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Default waypoint object selection strategy, will leave the list as it came from the object manager.

TunableTuple.name: sorted_by_distance
TunableTuple.description: Sorted by distance object selection strategy, will sort using just the x position of each object.

TunableVariant.name: placement_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the objects where the waypoints will be generated will be restricted to either the inside of outside.

Tunable.name: inside_only
Tunable.description: If checked objects will be restricted to the inside the house, otherwise only objects outside will be considered.

Tunable.name: randomize_order
Tunable.description: If checked, the waypoints will be shuffled into a random order each time the route is generated. If not they will be the same (but still non-deterministic) order each time, for a given run.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: lot_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are random points on the lot.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: constraint_parameters
TunableTuple.description: Parameters used to generate the constraints that will be used to generate waypoints.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at most this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at least this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The minimum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

Tunable.name: constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each of the generated waypoint constraints.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableVariant.name: object_tag_generator
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, in addition to generating random points on the lot, this generator also ensures that all constraints that would be generated by the Tag generator are also hit. This gets you a very specific behavior: apparent randomness but the guarantee that all objects with specific tags are route to.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on the possible objects that match the tuned tags.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constrain_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the circle that will be generated around the objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_max_distance
Tunable.description: The maximum distance to check for an object as the next target of our waypoint interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_search_strategy
TunableVariant.description: Search strategies to find and soft the possible objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: default_waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Default waypoint object selection strategy, will leave the list as it came from the object manager.

TunableTuple.name: sorted_by_distance
TunableTuple.description: Sorted by distance object selection strategy, will sort using just the x position of each object.

TunableEnum.description: Find all of the objects based on these tags.

TunableVariant.name: placement_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the objects where the waypoints will be generated will be restricted to either the inside of outside.

Tunable.name: inside_only
Tunable.description: If checked objects will be restricted to the inside the house, otherwise only objects outside will be considered.

Tunable.name: randomize_order
Tunable.description: If checked, the waypoints will be shuffled into a random order each time the route is generated. If not they will be the same (but still non-deterministic) order each time, for a given run.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoints_outside_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, only waypoints outside of a block will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: multiple_objects_by_tag
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on the possible objects that match the tuned tags.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constrain_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the circle that will be generated around the objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_max_distance
Tunable.description: The maximum distance to check for an object as the next target of our waypoint interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_search_strategy
TunableVariant.description: Search strategies to find and soft the possible objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: default_waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Default waypoint object selection strategy, will leave the list as it came from the object manager.

TunableTuple.name: sorted_by_distance
TunableTuple.description: Sorted by distance object selection strategy, will sort using just the x position of each object.

TunableEnum.description: Find all of the objects based on these tags.

TunableVariant.name: placement_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the objects where the waypoints will be generated will be restricted to either the inside of outside.

Tunable.name: inside_only
Tunable.description: If checked objects will be restricted to the inside the house, otherwise only objects outside will be considered.

Tunable.name: randomize_order
Tunable.description: If checked, the waypoints will be shuffled into a random order each time the route is generated. If not they will be the same (but still non-deterministic) order each time, for a given run.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: object_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on a constraint around the target object. Waypoints will consist of a waypoint at the target object and a random one inside the object constraint raidus to have the Sim move back and forward around the object.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, of the generated constraint around the target object where the waypoints will be generated.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoint_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each generated waypoint inside the object constraint radius for the Sim to route to.

TunableTuple.name: pacing
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on a constraint around the target object. Waypoints will consist of a waypoint at the target object and a random one inside the object constraint raidus to have the Sim move back and forward around the object.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: constraint_parameters
TunableTuple.description: Parameters used to generate the constraints that will be used to generate waypoints.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at most this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at least this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The minimum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

Tunable.name: object_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, of the generated constraint around the target object where the waypoints will be generated.

Tunable.name: waypoint_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each generated waypoint inside the object constraint radius for the Sim to route to.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: outside_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will attempt to place a jig outside to find a starting location, then validate all goals in the constraint radius to ensure they are outside. Otherwise, we will route fail. Note: This will generate points on the world routing surface.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoint_min_distance
Tunable.description: Minimum distance between the waypoints. We want to space them out as much as possible. If after several tries we still cannot get a waypoint that satisfies this min distance, we pick the furthest.

TunableTuple.name: pool_laps
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated within a pool. Sims appear to swim laps.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constraint_width
Tunable.description: The width of the constraint created around the edge of the pool.

TunableVariant.name: keep_away_from_edges
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, turns on a constraint that forces sims away from the pool edges by a tuned distance.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The distance from the pool edge.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: ocean_constraint_distance_past_swim_portal
Tunable.display: Ocean Constraint Distance Past Swim Portal
Tunable.description: When in the ocean, an offset away from the nearest swim portal to center the area to generate waypoints.

Tunable.name: ocean_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: When in the ocean, the radius of the area around the nearest swim portal to generate waypoints.

Tunable.name: ocean_unique_goal_count
Tunable.description: When in the ocean, the number of unique waypoints to generate.

Tunable.name: shuffle_waypoints
Tunable.description: If true, pool edge waypoint constraints will be shuffled and traversed in a random order. If false, pool edge waypoint constraints will be traversed in counter-clockwise order.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: spawn_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on spawn points in the world. Sims are forced to be in the open streets before routing through all the waypoints.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each of the generated waypoint constraints.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableVariant.description: Controls which spawn points can be used as waypoints.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: unobstructed_line
TunableTuple.description: A waypoint generator that builds a series of waypoints in a line and also makes the area around those waypoints unroutable for the duration of the interaction with an update to the navmesh. The line will always begin on the routing sim.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: fgl_parameters
TunableTuple.description: Arguments that will affect the FGL.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the line polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. To disallow water placement, set to 0.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the line polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. 0 indicates that all water placement is valid. To allow land placement, leave untuned.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

Tunable.name: line_length
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, of the generated constraint around the target object where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableVariant.name: waypoint_constraint_override
TunableVariant.description: Different waypoint_constraint paths to follow depending on whether or not it passes the test. It will replace waypoint_constraint.

TunableTuple.description: Different waypoint_constraint paths to follow depending on whether or not it passes the test.

TdescFragTag.name: test
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for select this waypoint_constraint.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a WaypointGraph tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: ellipse
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated on an ellipse.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: offset
TunableTuple.description: The offset of the ellipse relative to the target's position.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

Tunable.name: orientation
Tunable.description: The orientation of the ellipse relative to the target's orientation. The major axis is X if the angle is 0. If the angle is 90 degrees, then the major axis is Z.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: x_radius_interval
TunableTuple.description: The min and max radius of the x axis. Make the interval 0 to get rid of variance.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: z_radius_interval
TunableTuple.description: The min and max radius of the z axis. Make the interval 0 to get rid of variance.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: footprint
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated on the bounds of the target's footprint.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: corner_radius
Tunable.description: The min and max radius of the corner. This determines how tight the corners are.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: offset_size
Tunable.description: The offset of the footprint. positive means we enlarge the footprint, negative means we shrink it.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: gig_objects
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on the possible objects added during the gig. As of 2/23/21, this is only supported by the GP10 Interior Decorator Gig, pulling objects stored by the client-side Gig Object Tracker.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constrain_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the circle that will be generated around the objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_max_distance
Tunable.description: The maximum distance to check for an object as the next target of our waypoint interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_search_strategy
TunableVariant.description: Search strategies to find and soft the possible objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: default_waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Default waypoint object selection strategy, will leave the list as it came from the object manager.

TunableTuple.name: sorted_by_distance
TunableTuple.description: Sorted by distance object selection strategy, will sort using just the x position of each object.

TunableVariant.name: placement_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the objects where the waypoints will be generated will be restricted to either the inside of outside.

Tunable.name: inside_only
Tunable.description: If checked objects will be restricted to the inside the house, otherwise only objects outside will be considered.

Tunable.name: randomize_order
Tunable.description: If checked, the waypoints will be shuffled into a random order each time the route is generated. If not they will be the same (but still non-deterministic) order each time, for a given run.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: lot_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are random points on the lot.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: constraint_parameters
TunableTuple.description: Parameters used to generate the constraints that will be used to generate waypoints.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at most this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at least this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The minimum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

Tunable.name: constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each of the generated waypoint constraints.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableVariant.name: object_tag_generator
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, in addition to generating random points on the lot, this generator also ensures that all constraints that would be generated by the Tag generator are also hit. This gets you a very specific behavior: apparent randomness but the guarantee that all objects with specific tags are route to.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on the possible objects that match the tuned tags.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constrain_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the circle that will be generated around the objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_max_distance
Tunable.description: The maximum distance to check for an object as the next target of our waypoint interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_search_strategy
TunableVariant.description: Search strategies to find and soft the possible objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: default_waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Default waypoint object selection strategy, will leave the list as it came from the object manager.

TunableTuple.name: sorted_by_distance
TunableTuple.description: Sorted by distance object selection strategy, will sort using just the x position of each object.

TunableEnum.description: Find all of the objects based on these tags.

TunableVariant.name: placement_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the objects where the waypoints will be generated will be restricted to either the inside of outside.

Tunable.name: inside_only
Tunable.description: If checked objects will be restricted to the inside the house, otherwise only objects outside will be considered.

Tunable.name: randomize_order
Tunable.description: If checked, the waypoints will be shuffled into a random order each time the route is generated. If not they will be the same (but still non-deterministic) order each time, for a given run.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoints_outside_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, only waypoints outside of a block will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: multiple_objects_by_tag
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on the possible objects that match the tuned tags.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constrain_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the circle that will be generated around the objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled

Tunable.name: object_max_distance
Tunable.description: The maximum distance to check for an object as the next target of our waypoint interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_search_strategy
TunableVariant.description: Search strategies to find and soft the possible objects where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableTuple.name: default_waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Default waypoint object selection strategy, will leave the list as it came from the object manager.

TunableTuple.name: sorted_by_distance
TunableTuple.description: Sorted by distance object selection strategy, will sort using just the x position of each object.

TunableEnum.description: Find all of the objects based on these tags.

TunableVariant.name: placement_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the objects where the waypoints will be generated will be restricted to either the inside of outside.

Tunable.name: inside_only
Tunable.description: If checked objects will be restricted to the inside the house, otherwise only objects outside will be considered.

Tunable.name: randomize_order
Tunable.description: If checked, the waypoints will be shuffled into a random order each time the route is generated. If not they will be the same (but still non-deterministic) order each time, for a given run.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: object_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on a constraint around the target object. Waypoints will consist of a waypoint at the target object and a random one inside the object constraint raidus to have the Sim move back and forward around the object.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: object_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, of the generated constraint around the target object where the waypoints will be generated.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoint_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each generated waypoint inside the object constraint radius for the Sim to route to.

TunableTuple.name: pacing
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on a constraint around the target object. Waypoints will consist of a waypoint at the target object and a random one inside the object constraint raidus to have the Sim move back and forward around the object.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: constraint_parameters
TunableTuple.description: Parameters used to generate the constraints that will be used to generate waypoints.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at most this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, generate waypoints at locations that are at least this deep.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The minimum water depth allowed for each waypoint.

Tunable.name: object_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, of the generated constraint around the target object where the waypoints will be generated.

Tunable.name: waypoint_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each generated waypoint inside the object constraint radius for the Sim to route to.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: outside_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will attempt to place a jig outside to find a starting location, then validate all goals in the constraint radius to ensure they are outside. Otherwise, we will route fail. Note: This will generate points on the world routing surface.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoint_min_distance
Tunable.description: Minimum distance between the waypoints. We want to space them out as much as possible. If after several tries we still cannot get a waypoint that satisfies this min distance, we pick the furthest.

TunableTuple.name: pool_laps
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated within a pool. Sims appear to swim laps.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constraint_width
Tunable.description: The width of the constraint created around the edge of the pool.

TunableVariant.name: keep_away_from_edges
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, turns on a constraint that forces sims away from the pool edges by a tuned distance.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The distance from the pool edge.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: ocean_constraint_distance_past_swim_portal
Tunable.display: Ocean Constraint Distance Past Swim Portal
Tunable.description: When in the ocean, an offset away from the nearest swim portal to center the area to generate waypoints.

Tunable.name: ocean_constraint_radius
Tunable.description: When in the ocean, the radius of the area around the nearest swim portal to generate waypoints.

Tunable.name: ocean_unique_goal_count
Tunable.description: When in the ocean, the number of unique waypoints to generate.

Tunable.name: shuffle_waypoints
Tunable.description: If true, pool edge waypoint constraints will be shuffled and traversed in a random order. If false, pool edge waypoint constraints will be traversed in counter-clockwise order.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: spawn_points
TunableTuple.description: The waypoints are generated based on spawn points in the world. Sims are forced to be in the open streets before routing through all the waypoints.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

Tunable.name: constraint_radius
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, for each of the generated waypoint constraints.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableVariant.description: Controls which spawn points can be used as waypoints.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

TunableTuple.name: unobstructed_line
TunableTuple.description: A waypoint generator that builds a series of waypoints in a line and also makes the area around those waypoints unroutable for the duration of the interaction with an update to the navmesh. The line will always begin on the routing sim.

Tunable.name: _loops
Tunable.description: The number of loops we want to perform per route.

TunableTuple.name: fgl_parameters
TunableTuple.description: Arguments that will affect the FGL.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the line polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. To disallow water placement, set to 0.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the line polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. 0 indicates that all water placement is valid. To allow land placement, leave untuned.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

Tunable.name: line_length
Tunable.description: The radius, in meters, of the generated constraint around the target object where the waypoints will be generated.

TunableVariant.name: mobile_posture_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the mobile posture specified would require the sim to be in this posture to begin the route. This allows us to make the Sim Swim or Ice Skate instead of walk/run.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The mobile posture we want to use.

Tunable.name: use_provided_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the target's provided routing surface if it has one.

Tunable.name: waypoint_count
Tunable.description: The number of waypoints to select, from spawn points in the zone, to visit for a Jog prior to returning to the original location.

TunableVariant.name: waypoint_override_agent_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, use the specified value as the agent radius when generating goals for the waypoints. The agent radius is restored for the actual route.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The value to use as the agent radius when generating goals.

Tunable.name: waypoint_randomize_orientation
Tunable.description: Make Waypoint orientation random. Default is velocity aligned.

TunableVariant.name: waypoint_route_fail_balloon
TunableVariant.description: Tuning for balloon to show when failing to plan a aroute for this waypoint interaction.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.description: A variant of either a single icon or a category of icons. Optionally, test whether this element should be available.

TunableTuple.name: balloon_icon
TunableTuple.description: The tuning for the actual balloon icon.

TunableEnum.name: balloon_type
TunableEnum.description: The visual style of the balloon background. For example if it is a speech balloon or a thought balloon.

TunableVariant.name: category_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled balloon will display an additional category icon.

TunableVariant.name: show_category_icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

Tunable.name: career_reference
Tunable.description: The Career to override the icon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the career.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who's ranked statistic we want to get.

Tunable.name: ranked_statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic to find the icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant is secret for which we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

Tunable.name: career_reference
Tunable.description: The Career to override the icon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the career.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who's ranked statistic we want to get.

Tunable.name: ranked_statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic to find the icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant is secret for which we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: overlay
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon, if present.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: none
TunableTuple.description: Routes are generated without waypoints. Each generated location involves a single route. Use this option when the expectation is that routes are generally long (e.g. walkbys). The Sim will route to a waypoint, stop, and then plan for the next waypoint. This looks worse than default stitching, but is more performant.

TunableTuple.name: waypoints
TunableTuple.description: Routes are stitched together using waypoints as long as they are not too long or complex. Use this option when the expectation is that this interaction is confined to a small space and involves short routes. The Sim will route seamlessly through the various waypoints.

Tunable.name: max_distance
Tunable.description: If the route's cumulative distance is more than this value, the route is split.

Tunable.name: max_goals
Tunable.description: If the route has more than this number of goals, the route is split.

TunableTuple.name: waypoint_walk_style
TunableTuple.description: The walkstyle to use when routing between waypoints.

TunableList.name: additional_run_flags
TunableList.description: Define where the Sim is allowed to run with the walkstyle. It is combined with Run Allowed Flags from the Routing Component and any Additional Run Flags from walkstyle overrides. These flags may be removed by Removed Run Flags from walkstyle overrides. NOTE: This is *additive*, meaning the resulting run flags for a Sim are defined by the default tuning plus all overrides. However, Removed Run Flags is applied last.

Tunable.name: can_replace_with_short_walkstyle
Tunable.description: If checked, this walkstyle can be replaced with the short walkstyle tuned on the routing component if the path distance is shorter than the short walkstyle distance (also tuned on the routing component). Note that if you never want a certain walkstyle to be replaced by the default short walkstyle, you can use the 'short walkstyle map' (also on the routing component) to override it. Also note that if this walkstyle ends up being replaced via 'Combo Walktyle Replacements' (also on the routing component), the replaced walkstyle will not adhere to this tuning.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the walkstyle. Higher priority walkstyles will take precedence over lower priority. Equal priority will favor recent requests.

TunableList.name: removed_run_flags
TunableList.description: Modify a Sim's ability to run. It may disable any Run Allowed Flags from the Routing Component or Additional Run Flags added by walkstyle overrides. NOTE: This is *additive* with respect to all overrides, and is applied to the combination of the default tuning plus Additional Run Flags from all overrides. e.g.: The default behavior for a human is to exclusively run outdoors. A hypothetical 'excitable' trait might add the ability to run indoors (meaning the total result is indoors+outdoors). However, the 'pregnant' trait might remove the ability to run (both outdoors and indoors), effectively preventing the Sim from running at all.

Tunable.name: walkstyle
Tunable.description: The locomotion resource (i.e. walkstyle) to request. Depending on the tuned priority and other requests active on the Sim, this may or may not apply immediately.
